actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on September 18, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Bill Richardson.
The House observed a moment of silence in rememberance of the victims of the recent shooting in Orange County, California.

Mr. Fulcher asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, September 14, 2023, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, September 18, 2023 for Morning-Hour debate and 2 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1450 — "To amend the Agricultural Act of 2014 to modify the treatment of revenue from timber sale contracts and certain payments made by counties to the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior under good neighbor agreements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 222
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 193

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Levin moved to recommit to the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1435.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1435 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 681. H.R. 1435 — "To amend the Clean Air Act to prevent the elimination of the sale of internal combustion engines."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 215
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 681.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 681 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1435) to amend the Clean Air Act to prevent the elimination of the sale of internal combustion engines."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Sorensen to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Chaplain (Major) Troy S. Bates, U.S. Army, United States Military Academy West Point, N.Y.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Morgan Luttrell to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
